comments.creator: baum_j@yahoo.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

TheMarker is a leading business newspaper in Israel.
It's talkbacks won't open.
I need to open Chrome for them to open.
Just scroll-down to the TalkBack section (even if you don't understand Hebrew) and click on any of them.
Try to do the s

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to: http://www.themarker.com/consumer/tourism/1.636425#haaretz
Or any other story in this site
2. Scroll-down to the TalkBack/User comments section
It's down there - even if you don't understand Hebrew
3. Randomly select a few, and click on them - the actual comment won't open.
4. For comparison, do the same in Chrome - it will open

I need to open Chrome for them to open.
Just scroll-down to the TalkBack section (even if you don't understand Hebrew) and click on any of them.
Try to do the s

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to: http://www.themarker.com/consumer/tourism/1.636425#haaretz
Or any other story in this site
2. Scroll-down to the TalkBack/User comments section

4. For comparison, do the same in Chrome - it will open

comments.creator: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.text:
Works for me (comments open) with new clean profiles and:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110504 Firefox/6.0a1
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic%20Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile
